poem:
Title: The Halt

Charity, borne on wings, now falls in Gaza's dust.
Wiped out by drone attack, a pulse of trust.
Seven hearts beat no more in helping fist,
Closing doors of hope, shrouded in mournful mist.
The Taste of Aid hides beneath the tumult's crust,
As storms of tears from the world's kindred rust.
Yet, we'll rise again, amidst rage and gust.
